item.title: 印度石油公司与国家核公司就小型反应堆进行谈判
item.description: 国营印度石油公司（Indian Oil Corp.印度石油有限公司正在与印度原子能垄断公司就建造小型核电机组进行初步谈判。【原文：State-run Indian Oil Corp. Ltd. is in preliminary talks with India’s atomic power monopoly to build small nuclear units, an early-stage technology seen as a cost-effective alternative to larger plants.】

item.title: 中国央行更加关注经济的短期困境
item.description: 中国央行誓言从现有的促进增长政策中获得更多收益，承认尽管今年出现了一些改善迹象，但经济仍受到需求低迷和情绪不振的影响。【原文：China’s central bank vowed to get more out of its existing pro-growth policies, acknowledging that the economy is suffering from subdued demand and downbeat sentiment despite some signs of improvement this year.】

item.title: 开始一天生活所需的五件事美洲
item.description: 早上好。市场在等待鲍威尔的言论，就业数据提供了薪资预览，花旗集团策略师称美股有恢复涨势的空间。以下是交易员们正在谈论的话题。【原文：Good morning. Markets wait for Powell comments, jobs data gives a payrolls preview and Citigroup strategists say US stocks have room to resume their gains. Here’s what traders are talking about. — David Goodman】

item.title: 皮尔-亨特称英国小盘股指数即将消亡
item.description: 伦敦股票经纪公司 Peel Hunt Ltd 警告说，如果目前的收购活动水平持续下去，而首次公开募股市场又无法反弹，那么到 2028 年，英国小盘股指数将不复存在。【原文：An index of UK small-cap stocks will cease to exist by 2028 if the current level of takeover activity persists and the initial public offering market fails to rebound, London stockbroker Peel Hunt Ltd warned.】

item.title: 蓝猫途鹰将在最新保险交易中收购 Kuvare 资产管理公司
item.description: 蓝猫头鹰资本公司（Blue Owl Capital Inc.【原文：Blue Owl Capital Inc. has agreed to buy Kuvare Asset Management, the latest deal to underline a push by private-markets investment firms to tap pools of assets in the insurance market.】

item.title: Pimco 提升债券押注 美联储减息幅度将低于全球同行
item.description: 太平洋投资管理公司（Pacific Investment Management Co）的安德鲁-鲍尔斯（Andrew Balls）说，债券市场押注美联储未来几年降息幅度将低于其他主要央行的时机已经成熟。【原文：The time is ripe for bond-market bets that the Federal Reserve will lower interest rates less than other major central banks in the next couple years, says Andrew Balls at Pacific Investment Management Co.】

item.title: NFL 头盔制造商 Riddell 从 BC Partners 获得 4 亿美元投资
item.description: 根据彭博新闻社看到的一份声明，BC Partners 的信贷部门同意向足球头盔制造商 Riddell 提供 4 亿美元，这笔交易将使包括私募股权公司 Fenway Partners 在内的股东获得期待已久的回报。【原文：The credit arm of BC Partners agreed to provide $400 million to football helmet maker Riddell, in a deal that will give shareholders including private equity firm Fenway Partners a long-awaited payout, according to a statement seen by Bloomberg News.】

item.title: 香港放宽更改身份证性别的手术要求
item.description: 香港放宽了变性人在官方身份证上更改性别的一些规定，但仍保留了强制进行某些类型手术的要求。【原文：Hong Kong eased some rules for transgender people in order to change their gender on official ID cards but maintained a requirement mandating some types of surgery.】

item.title: 汇丰银行告知香港股东仍将关注股息问题
item.description: 汇丰控股有限公司（HSBC Holdings Plc）高级管理人员在香港举行的投资者会议上向股东保证，该银行将继续专注于支付股息。【原文：HSBC Holdings Plc’s senior executives reassured shareholders that the lender remains focused on paying dividends at an investor meeting in Hong Kong.】

item.title: 加拿大皇家银行在为石油融资的同时努力实现绿色发展
item.description:
加拿大皇家银行的苦难表明，银行在向低碳未来转型时必须小心谨慎。【原文：

Royal Bank of Canada’s travails show the fine line banks must walk in shifting toward a lower-carbon future.

】

item.title: 欧元区通胀率逼近 2%，关注 6 月减税政策
item.description: 欧元区通胀放缓幅度超过预期，巩固了欧洲中央银行 6 月份降息的前景。【原文：Euro-area inflation slowed more than expected, cementing prospects for an interest-rate cut by the European Central Bank in June.】

item.title: 世界劳动力市场逆势而上，迫使降息押注重启
item.description: 发达国家大部分地区的劳动力市场持续超出预期，从而推低了对降息的押注，因为各国央行终究能实现软着陆的希望越来越大。【原文：Labor markets across most of the developed world just keep on beating expectations, pushing back bets on interest-rate cuts as hopes grow that central banks can pull off a soft landing after all.】

item.title: 多伦多房价自 7 月以来第二次月度上涨
item.description: 多伦多房价连续第二个月上涨，原因是购房者在适应了较高的抵押贷款利率后，他们之间的竞争有所加剧。【原文：Toronto home prices rose for a second straight month as competition between buyers picked up after they adjusted to higher mortgage rates.】

item.title: 法国巴黎银行受高额租金影响将削减新加坡大厦面积
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，由于新加坡金融中心的商业租金不断上涨，法国巴黎银行（BNP Paribas SA）将放弃新加坡一座黄金办公楼的空间。【原文：BNP Paribas SA is set to give up space in a prime office tower in Singapore amid rising commercial rent in the financial hub, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 中国放宽汽车贷款比例以促进电动汽车行业发展
item.description: 中国放宽了个人购车的贷款比例，以促进汽车行业的发展，尤其是电动汽车的发展。【原文：China relaxed the loan ratios for personal vehicle purchases as the country seeks to boost its automotive sector, particularly electric vehicles.】

item.title: 印度煤矿公司计划 7.2 亿美元出售可再生能源部门
item.description: 国营煤矿和电力生产商 NLC India Ltd. 正计划出售价值约 600 亿卢比（7.2 亿美元）的可再生资产。【原文：State-run coal miner and power producer NLC India Ltd. is planning to sell renewable assets worth an estimated 60 billion rupees ($720 million).】

item.title: Blackstone 的 BREIT 在 2023 年的赔付率超过其收益率
item.description: Blackstone Real Estate Income Trust（黑石房地产收益信托基金）是这家另类资产管理公司面向富裕投资者的旗舰基金，去年支付的现金超过了收入。【原文：Blackstone Real Estate Income Trust, the alternative asset manager’s flagship fund for wealthy investors, paid out more cash than it generated last year.】

item.title: 中国与人民币熊市的较量有可能引发激烈反应
item.description: 中国对本国货币的捍卫正迈向一个里程碑式的时刻，这可能会引发当局做出更有力的反应，惩罚做空者。【原文：China’s defense of its currency is heading toward a milestone moment that may trigger a more forceful response from authorities to punish short-sellers.】

item.title: 贝莱德和 KKR 向阿布扎比公司出售 Adnoc 石油管道股份
item.description: 一家总部位于阿布扎比的另类投资基金从贝莱德公司和 KKR & Co.【原文：An Abu Dhabi-based alternate investment fund has bought a 40% stake in Adnoc’s oil pipeline network from BlackRock Inc. and KKR & Co.】

item.title: 方正集团债券持有人要求中国承认 Keepwell 裁决
item.description: 北京一家法院被要求审理一起案件，该案可能会为某些债券提供的付款保护开创先例，也可能会为香港司法机构在中国大陆的影响力开创先例。【原文：A Beijing court is being asked to consider a case that may set precedents for the payment protection provided on some bonds — and also the sway of Hong Kong’s judiciary in mainland China.】

item.title: 花旗策略师称资金流动预示美股仍有反弹空间
item.description: 花旗集团（Citigroup Inc.【原文：Investors appear to be showing “persistent” demand for US stocks, according to Citigroup Inc. strategists, suggesting there’s room for the rally to resume after the recent pullback.】

item.title: 马来西亚总统纳吉布寻求在软禁状态下服刑
item.description: 被监禁的马来西亚前总理纳吉布-拉扎克（Najib Razak）正在寻求法院命令，让他在软禁状态下服完与 1MDB 有关的剩余刑期。【原文：Imprisoned former Malaysian Prime Minister Najib Razak is seeking a court order to serve the remainder of his 1MDB-linked jail sentence under house arrest.】

item.title: 越南总理敦促 "大力 "推动 2024 年 GDP 增长达到 6.5
item.description: 越南政府网站发表声明称，越南总理范明正敦促各部委和各省政府采取 "严厉行动"，使国家实现 2024 年 6.5%的增长目标。【原文：Vietnam’s Prime Minister Pham Minh Chinh urged ministries and provincial governments to embrace “drastic actions” to enable the nation to hit its 2024 growth target of 6.5%, according to a statement on the government’s website.】

item.title: 土耳其通胀再次加速，接近 70%，尽管利率已上调
item.description: 尽管土耳其采取了一系列积极的加息措施，但其通货膨胀率仍连续第五个月上升，逼近 70%。【原文：Turkey’s inflation rate rose for a fifth straight month, edging closer to 70% despite a series of aggressive interest-rate hikes.】

item.title: 中国将取消天然气价格限制以支持经销商
item.description: 中国城市的天然气分销商可能会提高家庭用气价格，因为政府坚持要求这些公司转嫁更多的进口燃料成本，以支持这些公司的发展。【原文：Natural gas distributors in Chinese cities are likely to raise prices for households as the government moves to support the companies by insisting they pass on more of the costs of imported fuel.】

item.title: 富时 100 指数直播：英国市场现在的动向
市场正迎来周期性复苏。忘记着陆
item.description:
经济正在上升，投资者的反应应该是价值高于增长，股票高于债券。【原文：

The economy is gaining altitude, and investor reaction should be good for value over growth, and stocks over bonds.

】

item.title: 开始一天生活所需的五件事欧洲
item.description:
及时了解市场监测情况

Get up to speed with what the markets are monitoring

】

item.title: 通胀降温，先令反弹，肯尼亚将维持利率不变：日间指南
item.description: 肯尼亚很可能在周三将基准利率维持在 12 年来的高位不变，为通胀压力的缓解留出更多时间，然后再在十多年来最急剧的紧缩周期中放宽政策。【原文：Kenya is likely to leave the benchmark interest rate unchanged at a 12-year high on Wednesday, giving more time for inflationary pressures to ease before it loosens up on its steepest tightening cycle in more than a decade.】

item.title: 2024 年第二季度值得关注的 10 家公司
item.description: Bloomberg Intelligence 的分析师从数千家上市公司中筛选出少数几家公司，重点推荐给投资者。【原文：Analysts at Bloomberg Intelligence have sifted through thousands of publicly traded companies to highlight a select few for investors.】
